meanings.definition: The unintended adverse results of a political or military action.
meanings.sent1: The blowback from the decision to cut funding was severe.
meanings.sent2: The country faced blowback after the controversial policy was implemented.
meanings.sent3: The blowback from the new law led to some unexpected consequences.
meanings.sent4: The blowback of the military operation was felt across the region.
meanings.sent5: The blowback of the political scandal was impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: The backward escape of gases or powder residue from a firearm.
meanings.sent1: He felt the blowback from the gun as he fired it.
meanings.sent2: The detective examined the blowback to gather evidence.
meanings.sent3: The blowback from the rifle left a mark on his shoulder.
meanings.sent4: The blowback of the shotgun surprised the new shooter.
meanings.sent5: The blowback of the pistol was stronger than expected.

meanings.definition: A type of recoil experienced in firearms.
meanings.sent1: The shooter adjusted his grip to control the blowback.
meanings.sent2: The instructor explained how to minimize blowback when shooting.
meanings.sent3: The blowback from the rifle made him stumble backward.
meanings.sent4: The blowback of the revolver was noticeable but manageable.
meanings.sent5: The blowback of the gun was a key factor in his accuracy.
